sections.heading: Everest Base Camp Trek Overview
articles: The Everest Base Camp Trek is the most iconic trekking destination on Earth. This 13-day adventure takes you from the dramatic Lukla airstrip to Everest Base Camp at 5,364m, the staging point for climbers attempting Mount Everest (8,848m). You'll trek through the legendary Khumbu Valley, visit ancient monasteries, experience authentic Sherpa culture, and witness four 8,000m peaks: Everest, Lhotse, Nuptse, and Makalu. The trek culminates with a sunrise hike to Kala Patthar (5,545m) for the most iconic views of Mount Everest in the world.

bullets.text: Max altitude: 5,400m (Everest Base Camp), optional Kala Patthar summit to 5,545m
Difficult trek - requires excellent fitness and acclimatization discipline
UNESCO World Heritage Site - Sagarmatha National Park protection

itinerary_days.title: Arrival in Kathmandu & Briefing
itinerary_days.description: Arrive at Tribhuwan International Airport. EverTrek Nepal representative welcomes you. Afternoon trek briefing, equipment check, and exploration of Thamel district.

itinerary_days.title: Fly Kathmandu to Lukla & Trek to Phakding
itinerary_days.description: Early morning scenic 40-minute flight from Ramechap to Lukla (2,800m) - world's most dramatic mountain airport. Trek downhill to Phakding along Dudh Koshi River through rhododendron forests.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Phakding to Namche Bazaar
itinerary_days.description: Challenging day crossing multiple suspension bridges (famous Hillary Bridge) over Dudh Koshi River. Steep ascent to Namche Bazaar (3,440m), the Sherpa capital and main trading hub.

itinerary_days.title: Namche Bazaar - Acclimatization & Exploration
itinerary_days.description: Rest day to acclimatize to 3,440m. Hike to Everest View Hotel (3,880m) for first distant views of Mount Everest. Explore Namche's vibrant market, visit Tenzing Norgay Museum, and relax in local teahouses.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Namche to Tengboche
itinerary_days.description: Trek northeast through dense rhododendron and conifer forests. Pass Kyangjuma (3,650m) and climb to Tengboche (3,867m). Visit the famous Tengboche Monastery with panoramic Everest views.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Tengboche to Dingboche
itinerary_days.description: Trek to Pangboche village, visit the ancient gompa said to house yeti relics. Continue to Dingboche (4,410m), a small Sherpa settlement with potato fields and dramatic mountain views.

itinerary_days.title: Dingboche - Acclimatization Day
itinerary_days.description: Critical acclimatization day at 4,410m. Optional hike to Nagtsang Ri (4,600m) for panoramic views of Everest, Lhotse, Nuptse, and Ama Dablam. Rest and prepare for high altitude.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Dingboche to Lobuche
itinerary_days.description: Trek over rocky high-altitude terrain past memorials of fallen climbers and trekkers. Reach Lobuche (4,930m), a small settlement with prayer flags marking sacred spaces.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Lobuche to Gorakshep & Everest Base Camp Excursion
itinerary_days.description: Trek through boulder-filled terrain with views of Khumbu Icefall. Reach Gorakshep (5,185m), then make afternoon excursion to Everest Base Camp (5,364m). Return to Gorakshep for overnight.

itinerary_days.title: Kala Patthar Sunrise & Trek to Pheriche
itinerary_days.description: Pre-dawn hike to Kala Patthar (5,545m) for the world's most iconic sunrise views of Mount Everest. Descend to Pheriche (4,250m) for overnight. Longest day physically.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Pheriche to Tengboche
itinerary_days.description: Descend through forests returning to lower altitudes. Arrive at Tengboche for overnight. Body recovers from high altitude. Visit monastery for evening meditation.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Tengboche to Namche Bazaar
itinerary_days.description: Descend through rhododendron forests to Namche Bazaar. Relax and celebrate achievement. Visit shops, restaurants, and prepare for departure.

itinerary_days.title: Fly Lukla to Kathmandu & Celebration
itinerary_days.description: Trek down to Lukla. Afternoon scenic return flight to Ramechap. Evening celebration dinner with EverTrek Nepal team. Transfer to hotel.

highlights.title: World's Highest Peak - Everest at 8,848m
highlights.description:
Stand at Everest Base Camp (5,364m) and witness the base camp of the world's highest mountain. Hike to Kala Patthar (5,545m) for the most iconic sunrise views of Mount Everest - the most photographed mountain moment on Earth.
Experience the dramatic Khumbu Icefall from Gorakshep viewpoint.

highlights.title: Four 8,000m Peaks - Ultra High Mountain Views
highlights.description:
From various points on the trek, witness four of the world's highest mountains:
- Mount Everest (8,848m)
- Mount Lhotse (8,516m)
- Mount Nuptse (7,861m)
- Mount Makalu (8,485m)
Rare opportunity to see multiple 8,000m peaks in one trek.

highlights.title: Authentic Sherpa Culture & Ancient Monasteries
highlights.description:
Experience genuine Sherpa hospitality in teahouses run by local families. Visit sacred monasteries:
- Tengboche Monastery - one of Nepal's most important Buddhist sites
- Pangboche Gompa - said to house yeti relics
- Namche Bazaar - vibrant Sherpa trading hub with Tenzing Norgay Museum
Observe daily Sherpa life, traditions, and Buddhist practices.

highlights.title: Khumbu Icefall & Dramatic High-Altitude Terrain
highlights.description:
Trek through lunar-like landscapes with prayer flags, mani stones, and memorials. Witness the famous Khumbu Icefall - a spectacular frozen waterfall of ice blocks used by Everest climbers.
Experience boulder-filled moraines, glacial rivers, and high-altitude tundra ecosystem.

cost_and_date_section.intro_text: Everest Base Camp Trek departures available year-round with optimal conditions in Spring (March-May) and Autumn (September-November). Prices vary by group size and season. Early booking (8-12 weeks) recommended for peak seasons. Private group departures can be arranged on your preferred dates.

date_highlights.highlight: Spring (March-May): Clear skies, rhododendron blooms, comfortable temperatures
Autumn (Sept-Nov): Best visibility, dry weather, peak season popularity
Difficult trek - excellent fitness required despite popularity
Acclimatization critical - high altitude (5,400m) requires discipline

questions.question: Is Everest Base Camp Trek difficult?
questions.answer: Yes, it's a difficult trek. Maximum altitude is 5,364m - well into high altitude territory. Requires excellent fitness (4-6 weeks training) and strict acclimatization discipline. Not recommended for beginners, but achievable for those in good health.

questions.question: What is Acute Mountain Sickness (AMS) and how to prevent it?
questions.answer: AMS is caused by rapid altitude gain. Symptoms: headache, nausea, fatigue. Prevention: ascend slowly (day 4 rest, day 7 rest), hydrate constantly, eat carbs, avoid alcohol. We build acclimatization days into itinerary. Medications like Diamox available on consultation.

questions.question: Do I need prior trekking experience?
questions.answer: Not required, but helpful. Physical fitness is critical - you should be able to hike 6-8 hours daily on steep terrain. Train 4-6 weeks before departure with hill walking and gym cardio.

questions.question: What permits are required?
questions.answer: Two permits: TIMS Card (Trekkers Information Management System) and Sagarmatha National Park entry permit. Both included in package cost. EverTrek handles all documentation.

questions.question: Do I need travel insurance?
questions.answer: Yes, absolutely mandatory. Must cover high-altitude trekking (5,400m+) and emergency helicopter evacuation. Budget $50-150 for coverage. Check policy covers altitude limits.

additional_info_sections.heading: Critical Success Factors
articles: Everest Base Camp Trek success depends on three factors: (1) Physical fitness - train 4-6 weeks with hill walking and cardiovascular work. (2) Acclimatization discipline - respect the altitude, rest when needed, ascend slowly. (3) Mental attitude - expect cold, discomfort, and high-altitude fatigue. Success comes from preparation and patience, not speed.

The trek is popular but not easy. About 60,000 people attempt it annually; the majority succeed but many struggle. Proper preparation, realistic expectations, and guide support make all the difference.

bullets.text: Excellent fitness required - train 4-6 weeks minimum
Travel insurance with evacuation coverage mandatory
Acclimatization days built into itinerary - DO NOT skip them
March-May and Sept-Nov offer best weather and visibility
